DOC.brief_summary: This study investigate whether naftopidil effective spontaneous passage ureteral stone size 3 10 mm .
DOC.brief_title: Medical Expulsive Therapy Ureter Stone Using Naftopidil
DOC.detailed_description: 1 . Enrollment 1. patient ureteral stone size 3 10 mm 2. patient age 18 year 2 . Randomization 1. naftopidil 75 mg qd 14 day placebo 2 . Standard treatment pain-killers also apply . ( aceclofenac ) 3 . Follow-up 28 day 1 . We confirm stone free status CT X-ray film 14th 28th day . 2 . Rates active treatment also evaluate .
DOC.criteria: > = 20 year single 3 10 mm ureter stone ( long diameter ) Presence multiple ureter stone Renal insufficiency ( serum Cr > 1.4 mg/dL ) Febrile urinary tract infection ( fever > 38Â°C , evidence urinary infection ) pregnancy breast feed solitary kidney hypersensitivity naftopidil current use alphablocker , calciumchannel blocker , corticosteroid ( within 4 week ) moderate severe cardiovascular cerebrovascular disease hepatic dysfunction ( > 2 x normal upper limit ) significant active medical illness opinion investigator would preclude protocol treatment Genetic disorder Galactose intolerance , Lapp Lactase deficiency , GlucoseGalactose malabsorption
